Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2012 11:30AM Downey30 wrote: Hi, I am six weeks out from an  8 1/2 hour surgery.  I had NO voice when I woke up and this continured for three weeks.  I then saw an ENT who scoped my vocal cords and he found that my left one was paralyzed.  After over three weeks on steroids it is finally getting back to normal.  Not there yet.  I think this is very rare.
Posts.Title: General Anesthesia and vocal cords meny Cherilynn64

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2012 09:03PM Downey30 wrote: Hi,  for me I think one of the most important things to know is that you must be your own advocate as far as knowing what is available.  I have learned that physicians for the most part tell you only what is their scope of things.  Early detection, a positive attitude, and a lot of good support.  Hope this helps.
Posts.Title: Help writing a paper..Please All4God pupfoster1
